wikipedia_page.main: Philip Ashton (born 2 August 1988) is an English cricketer. He played two first-class matches for Cambridge University Cricket Club between 2009 and 2011.

response: Philip Ashton (17021746) was a castaway on uninhabited Roatán island in the Gulf of Honduras for 16 months in 1723/1724. His memoirs about his solitary stay were published in book form in Boston in 1725. While some people believed it was a novel in the style of Robinson Crusoe (1719), Ashton's book was the account of a genuine experience. He was born in Marblehead, Massachusetts in 1702 and married twice.Edward E. Leslie, "Desperate Journeys, Abandoned Souls", 1988, pp. 107–8
*Barnard, John. History of the Strange Adventures and Signal Deliverances of Mr. Philip Ashton, publ. by Samuel Gerrish, Boston (1725) (online source)

*Ashton's memorial. An history of the strange adventures, and signal deliverances, of Mr. Philip Ashton, who, after he had made his escape from the pirates, liv'd alone on a desolate island for about sixteen months.
*Andrews, Michael. Stranded in Roatan: The true account of escape from pirates by Philip Ashton in 1722 (online information)
